result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:23PM - 64-06 - Defendant Isaiah R Davis in court.  Attorney jeramiah maynard in court for Isaiah R Davis.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
State is requesting an Arraignment date, waiting on blood results.
Arraignment scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Notice to Person Posting Bond Money

Defendant Isaiah R Davis in court, in custody by video. JJ Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Selmek appeared for bond purposes only. Defendant does qualify for SPD. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Selmek. Argument, denied. Bond remains. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

DEFENDANT MUST POST $3000 CASH

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
